intro: Streptocarpus × lichtensteinensis, commonly known as the hybrid streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with fleshy, succulent leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Streptocarpus × lichtensteinensis is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
